awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for IEEE VTS "Diversity in VTS" Workshop 2019 (VTS "Diversity in VTS" 2019)
awd_abstract_narration:
Current trends in automotive technology crucially involve connectivity and autonomy as the major drivers of safety, reliability, and energy efficiency in future road transportation. The goal of the inaugural Diversity in VTS" workshop at VTC2019-Fall in Honolulu, Hawaii, Sept. 22 - 25, 2019, is to engage industry researchers, academic faculty members, and graduate students in interdisciplinary discussions on connected vehicles and autonomy. The IEEE Vehicular Technology Society (VTS) "Diversity in VTS" workshop will provide a common platform to enhance diversity in IEEE VTS and in the Engineering Community as a whole, by fostering the connection of women and other groups that represent minorities. The workshop is intended to create an opportunity to share experiences about the challenges that are faced by women and minorities in the engineering world and views on how to enhance diversity and increase the presence of minorities at all stages of their engineering careers.

A total of $10,000 will be used to support up to 10 under-represented students. One third of the travel grants will be reserved for first-time attendees of the IEEE Vehicular Technology Conference where the workshop is co-located. One third of the travel grants will be reserved for women and other under-represented students attending the conference. It is anticipated that this conference will be the first of many to be held at the twice-annual IEEE Vehicular Technology Conferences and will be a venue where students can learn and find mentors, both from peers and more well-established researchers.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF SANTA CLARA COLLEGE

por.por_cntn:
In 2019, the Vehicular Technology Society held its first diversity and inclusion workshop at the Vehicular Technology Conference (VTC) Fall 2019 in Honolulu, Hawaii, USA. The workshop’s goal is to foster an inclusive environment for all voices in the engineering community. The project allowed students from underrepresented minorities to attend a first-class conference on wireless communications, with important new topics such as vehicular communication. The project also allowed the first diversity and inclusion workshop to be held at the IEEE Vehicular Technology Conference.  Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we did not support travel to an in-person workshop but held virtual workshops on diversity in Fall 2020, Spring 2022, and Spring 2023 with keynote speakers, panel discussions, and networking.  We planned an in-person stand alone workshop in San Diego for Spring 2024. However, it was difficult to hold such a workshop without the surrounding infrastructure of a conference and the workshop was canceled. Though this was disappointing, we learned lessons in workshop planning for diversity and engagement. The Vehicular Technology Society will hold a diversity workshop at its Fall 2024 conference in Washington, DC.  This grant allowed us to start a tradition of holding workshops with first-rate speakers and panels addressing issues for engineers from diverse backgrounds.


Last Modified: 09/05/2024
Modified by: Maria Kyrarini
